page.title: 03 Linlithgow Palace
page.content: In 1425 the building of{Linlithgow {Palace}was begun by James the 1 on the site of an earlier manor.In later years the Palace was added to by a number of Kings.The Palace was the birthplace of Mary Queen of Scots and tourists vist it regulary because of this. The Palace was out of use until 1633. Later Cromwells army held it from 1650 to 1659.In 1746 the Palace caught fire and was gutted. Today the {Palace}is one of the main tourist attractions in the town.Lots of people from all round the world come to visit it.Some members of our class saw the Chinese Prime Minister when he came in June of 1985 to visit the Palace.It is held in trust for the nation by the Secretary of State for Scotland and is looked after by the Department of the Environment
